About Dr. Anna

My name is Anna Polotskaia (she/her). My young clients tend to call me Dr. Anna. I am a clinical psychologist and a member of the College of Psychologists of Ontario registered with the in the areas of clinical child and school psychology. I work with diverse population of school-age children and teens, and their families. I strive to provide safe, culturally sustaining interventions for clients across genders, cultures and

I received a Master’s of Science in psychiatric research and a PhD in child clinical psychology at McGill University. This well-rounded clinical training provided me with an invaluable  foundation in child development, brain science, clinical approaches and educational practices.

In addition to doctoral level training I have completed a number of training programs for specific therapeutic approaches, including

  • Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT),
  • Motivational Interviewing (MI)
  • Dialectical Behavioural Therapy (CBT),
  • Mindfulness and Acceptance Commitment Therapy (ACT).

My Approach: Every Client and Every Family is Unique

My approach to therapy is always centred on compassionate client-centred care grounded in evidence-based research.

While working in collaboration with my clients I focus on their specific strengths, goals and needs, while also considering their unique store circumstances. As a youth therapist, I support youth in building their skills in self-awareness and self-reflection, while providing them with a safe non-judgmental space.

With over a decade of research and clinical work in hospitals, schools and community clinics, I am passionate about providing best care to young people facing difficulties.

Psychotherapy is a form of  treatment that allows young people and their families to become more aware and more skilled in coping with difficult situations and overwhelming feelings.

Learn more about my services

Please Keep in Mind

My part-time clinic offers virtual and in-person appointments. I also teach at the local university and consult at the school board.

Reach out via email or book a free 15-minute phone check to connect with Dr. Anna Polotskaia for you and your child's needs.
